quote.author: T. E. Lawrence
quote.body: All men dream, but not equally. Those who dream by night in the dusty recesses of their minds, wake in the day to find that it was vanity: but the dreamers of the day are dangerous men, for they may act on their dreams with open eyes, to make them possible.

quote.author: Thomas Fuller
quote.body: All things are difficult before they are easy.

quote.author: Karl Von Clausewitz
quote.body: Although our intellect always longs for clarity and certainty, our nature often finds uncertainty fascinating.

quote.author: Judy Garland
quote.body: Always be a first-rate version of yourself, instead of a second-rate version of somebody else.

quote.author: Dr. Seuss
quote.body: Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.

quote.author: Park Benjamin
quote.body: Beauty and grace command the world.

quote.author: Paul Rudnick
quote.body: Being gay and single is the new smoking. It won't be socially acceptable anymore, and you will have to go outside.

quote.author: Do Hyun Choe
quote.body: The biggest thing in this world, bigger than the ocean and the sky, is your heart.

quote.author: Woody Allen
quote.body: Bisexuality immediately doubles your chances for a date on Saturday night.

quote.author: Linda Lingle
quote.body: But before looking to the future, let's glance back at the road we've traveled these past two years because that is the source of much of the optimism we are all feeling about the future.

quote.author: William Scranton
quote.body: By Thursday morning, we'd gotten over the worst of it.

quote.author: Ray Kroc
quote.body: Creativity is a highfalutin word for the work I have to do between now and Tuesday.

quote.author: Elbert Hubbard
quote.body: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.

quote.author: Anonymous
quote.body: Everything will be okay in the end. If it's not okay, it's not the end.

quote.author: Mother Teresa
quote.body: Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.

quote.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote.body: Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could.

quote.author: Carl Sagan
quote.body: For small creatures such as we the vastness is bearable only through love.

quote.author: Reinhold Neibuhr
quote.body: Grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, courage to change those that I can, and wisdom to know the difference.

quote.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
quote.body: The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it.

quote.author: Ellen Page
quote.body: I call myself a feminist when people ask me if I am, and of course I am 'cause it's about equality, so I hope everyone is. You know you're working in a patriarchal society when the word feminist has a weird connotation.

quote.author: W. C. Fields
quote.body: I once spent a year in Philadelphia, I think it was on a Sunday.

quote.author: John Burroughs
quote.body: I still find each day too short for all the thoughts I want to think, all the walks I want to take, all the books I want to read, and all the friends I want to see.

quote.author: Louise Brealey
quote.body: I'd like every man who doesn't call himself a feminist to explain to the women in his life why he doesn't believe in equality for women.

quote.author: Mitch Hedberg
quote.body: I'm sick of following my dreams. I'm just going to ask them where they're going and hook up with them later.

quote.author: Katharine Hepburn
quote.body: If you obey all the rules, you miss all the fun.

quote.author: Noel Coward
quote.body: If you must have motivation, think of your paycheck on Friday.

quote.author: Jen Barber
quote.body: If you type 'Google' into Google, you will break the Internet.

quote.author: John Wooden
quote.body: If you're not making mistakes, then you're not doing anything. I'm positive that a doer makes mistakes.

quote.author: Carol Vargas
quote.body: If it's meant to be, it will happen.

quote.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote.body: Imagination rules the world.

quote.author: William G. McAdoo
quote.body: It is impossible to defeat an ignorant man in argument.

quote.author: Lucille Ball
quote.body: It's a helluva start, being able to recognize what makes you happy.

quote.author: Rev Dr. Martin Luther King
quote.body: Knowledge is a process of piling up facts; Wisdom lies in their simplification.

quote.author: Erwin Dieterich
quote.body: The last good thing written in C was Franz Schubert's Symphony Number 9.

quote.author: Henri Frederic Amiel
quote.body: Learn to... be what you are, and learn to resign with a good grace all that you are not.

quote.author: Morrie Schwartz
quote.body: The most important thing in life is to learn how to give out love, and to let it come in.

quote.author: Dalai Lama
quote.body: Most of our troubles are due to our passionate desire for and attachment to things that we misapprehend as enduring entities.

quote.author: Marlon Brando
quote.body: Never confuse the size of your paycheck with the size of your talent.

quote.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote.body: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.

quote.author: Zig Ziglar
quote.body: Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will.

quote.author: Paul J. Meyer
quote.body: Productivity is never an accident. It is always the result of a commitment to excellence, intelligent planning, and focused effort.

quote.author: Unknown
quote.body: Replace fear of the unknown with curiosity.

quote.author: Alan Jay Lerner
quote.body: A schedule so tight that it would only work if I didn't sleep on Monday nights.

quote.author: Cave Johnson
quote.body: Science isn't about why, it's about why not. You ask: why is so much of our science dangerous? I say: why not marry safe science if you love it so much. In fact, why not invent a special safety door that won't hit you in the butt on the way out, because you are fired. Yes you, box your stuff, out the front door, parking lot, car, goodbye.

quote.author: Oscar Wilde
quote.body: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others, whenever they go.

quote.author: Thomas Szasz
quote.body: The stupid neither forgive nor forget; the naive forgive and forget; the wise forgive but do not forget.

quote.author: Oprah Winfrey
quote.body: Surround yourself only with people who are going to lift you higher.

quote.author: Ernest Hemingway
quote.body: That terrible mood of depression of whether it's any good or not is what is known as The Artist's Reward.

quote.author: Robert A. Heinlein
quote.body: They didn't want it good, they wanted it Wednesday.

quote.author: JFK
quote.body: Tolerance implies no lack of commitment to one's own beliefs. Rather it condemns the oppression or persecution of others.

quote.author: Eugene Bullard
quote.body: Tout le sang qui coule rouge; All blood is red.

quote.author: Katharine Hepburn
quote.body: The Venus flytrap--a devouring organism, aptly named for the goddess of love.

quote.author: Yogi Berra
quote.body: We're lost, but we are making good time.

quote.author: Robert Wilensky
quote.body: We've all heard that million monkeys banging on a million typewriters will eventually reproduce the entire works of Shakespeare. Now, thanks to the Internet, we know this is not true.

quote.author: Lou Holtz
quote.body: When all is said and done, more is said than done.

quote.author: Pablo Picasso
quote.body: When you come right down to it, all you have is yourself. All the rest is nothing.

quote.author: Gloria Pritchett
quote.body: Where I come from, men cherish women. It goes wife, mistress, dog. Dog always at the bottom.

quote.author: Dr. Evil
quote.body: Why make trillions when we can make... billions?

quote.author: Jessica Hische
quote.body: The work you do while you procrastinate is probably the work you should be doing for the rest of your life.
